title: Lumiere programme
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Lumiere, Louis, 1864-1948
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - History
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion picture producers and directors - France
description: The first public film show in Great Britain was given at the Regent Street Polytechnic London, on February 20th, 1896, by the brothers August and Louis Lumiere. This film is a complete reprint of the programs shown on that occasion. It comprises the following subjects: Workers leaving the Lumiere factory; Baby at the lunch table; Demolition of a wall; Watering the gardener; Congress of Photographic Societies at Neuville-Sur-Saone, July 1895; Arrival of a train at Ciotat Station; A game of cards; A boat leaving harbour. None of these films is more than a single shot, without cutting or camera movement; their interest lay entirely in the novelty of the moving photograph. This version includes a piano accompaniment and narration which was added in 1956.
